description: Borrowed from French badinage, from the verb badiner (“jest, joke”) from badin (“playful”), from Occitan badar (“gape”). Distantly related to abash.

examples: Your badinage so airy, / Your manner arbitrary, / Are out of place / When face to face / With an influential Fairy.

verbs.description: badinage (third-person singular simple present badinages, present participle badinaging, simple past and past participle badinaged)

entries.meaning: To engage in badinage or playful banter.
